description: Audio recordings of healthy reefs—an underwater chorus of fish songs and crackles from snapping shrimp—may help efforts to restore coral ecosystems harmed by climate and human impacts, scientists said Wednesday.
title: Adagio in sea: Coral larvae 'settle near sounds of healthy reefs'

description: Since the 1990s, fast fashion has enabled everyday people to buy the latest catwalk trends. But the sheer volume of garments being whipped up, sold and soon discarded is contributing to a global sustainability crisis.
title: Opinion: Ultra-fast fashion is a disturbing trend undermining efforts to make the whole industry more sustainable

description: Why do humans experience menopause? It's a question that some women going through the symptoms might have asked themselves more than once.
title: Whale menopause sheds light on human evolutionary mystery

description: The San José was a galleon ship owned by King Philip V of Spain (1683–1746) in the 18th century. It sailed from Portobelo in present-day Panama to Cartagena in Colombia in 1708.
title: The sunken treasure of the San José shipwreck is contested—but its real riches go beyond coins and jewels

description: Ice melting has become an ever-pressing concern in recent decades as climate change has brought evocative images of lone polar bears floating on unsustainable small blocks of sea ice. Yet, the consequences are far-reaching in terms of freshening of seawater altering marine ecosystems, sea level rise exacerbating flooding and reduction of ice-albedo feedbacks that further modify Earth's temperature.
title: Greenland Ice Sheet motion minimally impacted by late-season melting, study finds

description: Scientists in Canada and the U.S. have discovered a new way in which Ebola—an often deadly virus affecting people mostly in sub-Saharan Africa—reproduces in the body.
title: Ebola: Scientists reveal a new way it replicates

description: A volcano in Iceland erupted Saturday evening for the fourth time in three months, sending orange jets of lava into the night sky.
title: A volcano in Iceland is erupting for the fourth time in 3 months, sending plumes of lava skywards

description: "Dune," widely considered one of the best sci-fi novels of all time, continues to influence how writers, artists and inventors envision the future.
title: How 'Dune' became a beacon for the fledgling environmental movement, and a rallying cry for the new science of ecology

description: Unique adaptations allow wild animals to survive temperature extremes that would quickly kill an unprotected human. For example, certain animals can withstand bitterly cold weather, thanks to the insulating properties of the hollow hairs that make up their coats.
title: Animal hair structure changes from summer to winter to fend off freezing weather, researchers show

description: Kombucha is a fermented tea known for its health benefits and tangy kick. But brewers can find it challenging to keep kombucha's alcohol levels low because the bacteria and yeast used in the fermentation process vary from batch to batch.
title: Better kombucha brewing through chemistry

description: Insects are typically unwelcome visitors to a picnic, but they could be a flavorful, nutritious and sustainable addition to the menu. Eating insects is common in some parts of the world, and some species are even considered delicacies.
title: Investigating the many flavors of edible ants
